author: asloley@endeavorb2b.com (Andrew Sloley, Plant InSites columnist)

title: Slideshow: Chemical Industry Products to Watch - August 2025

title_detail.value: Slideshow: Chemical Industry Products to Watch - August 2025

summary: This month’s roundup showcases smart sensing and energy-optimized technologies built for demanding environments. Highlights include a non-contact Hall Effect angle sensor for motion systems, a rotary lobe blower with variable speed control for efficient airflow management, and a pressure/vacuum relief valve with integrated flame arresting. Also featured are a turbine flow meter for high-accuracy gas measurement and an AI-powered methane emission detector that automates regulatory compliance in oil and gas operations.

summary_detail.value: This month’s roundup showcases smart sensing and energy-optimized technologies built for demanding environments. Highlights include a non-contact Hall Effect angle sensor for motion systems, a rotary lobe blower with variable speed control for efficient airflow management, and a pressure/vacuum relief valve with integrated flame arresting. Also featured are a turbine flow meter for high-accuracy gas measurement and an AI-powered methane emission detector that automates regulatory compliance in oil and gas operations.

author: jkatz@endeavorb2b.com (Jonathan Katz)

title: Slideshow: Top 5 Articles in July 2025

title_detail.value: Slideshow: Top 5 Articles in July 2025

summary: July's top articles highlighted key industry trends: Lubrizol's systematic transition from batch to continuous manufacturing through its MET program aims to boost efficiency and capacity. Heat integration via pinch analysis offers 20-50% energy savings yet remains underutilized across plants. Process control challenges emerged when series valve configurations created competing objectives requiring equipment removal. Innovative valve technologies are reducing fugitive emissions in oil and gas operations. Finally, Minnesota postponed PFAS reporting deadlines, giving manufacturers more time for compliance preparation. These developments reflect the industry's focus on operational efficiency, sustainability and evolving regulatory requirements.

summary_detail.value: July's top articles highlighted key industry trends: Lubrizol's systematic transition from batch to continuous manufacturing through its MET program aims to boost efficiency and capacity. Heat integration via pinch analysis offers 20-50% energy savings yet remains underutilized across plants. Process control challenges emerged when series valve configurations created competing objectives requiring equipment removal. Innovative valve technologies are reducing fugitive emissions in oil and gas operations. Finally, Minnesota postponed PFAS reporting deadlines, giving manufacturers more time for compliance preparation. These developments reflect the industry's focus on operational efficiency, sustainability and evolving regulatory requirements.
